CBIR launcher module (CBIR.py)

CBIR.get_serial_path(search_method: str, serialize: bool, wgrid=None, hgrid=None) → str

Returns path to load or store serialized data for a given search method.

Parameters

  • search_method (str) – type of search. Can be one of “smarthist”, “hist” or “col”.

  • serialize (bool) – whether serialization is to be performed. If ‘None’, no path will be returned

  • wgrid (int, optional) – number of rows to compute the image grid, defaults to 5

  • hgrid (int, optional) – number of columns to compute the image grid, defaults to 5

Returns

path to load or store serialized data

Return type

str

CBIR.parse_input_colour(colour: str) → numpy.ndarray

Parse input colour from string.

Parameters

colour (str) – colour to parse. Can be one of “blue”, “orange”, “pink”, “purple”, “yellow” or “custom”.

Returns

representation of the desired colour in l*a*b colour space.

Return type

np.darray

Histogram search (hist_search.py)

class hist_search.HistogramSearch(dataset: Union[Iterable[numpy.ndarray], str], serial_hist_path: Optional[str] = None, serial_grid_hist_path: Optional[str] = None)

This class implements a histogram search IR method, which allows for features like standard and smart histogram based content retrieval.

__init__(dataset: Union[Iterable[numpy.ndarray], str], serial_hist_path: Optional[str] = None, serial_grid_hist_path: Optional[str] = None) → None

Constructor for a HistogramSearch instance.

Parameters

  • dataset (Union[Iterable[np.ndarray],str]) – dataset of images or path to the directory containg input samples.

  • serial_hist_path (str, optional) – Path to serialize computed histograms, defaults to None

  • serial_grid_hist_path (str, optional) – Path to serialize computed grid histograms, defaults to None

calc_hist(img: Union[numpy.ndarray, str], n_channels: int = 3, per_channel_bins: int = 8, per_channel_range: int = (0, 256)) → numpy.ndarray

Compute a 3D RGB color histogram from the image, using per_channel_bins bins per channel.

Parameters

  • img (Union[np.ndarray,str]) – image or path to target image.

  • n_channels (int) – number of channels of the image, defaults to 3

  • per_channel_bins (int, optional) – number of bins per each used dimension, defaults to 8

  • per_channel_range (tuple, optional) – range of values to be measured per each dimension, defaults to (0,256)

Returns

histogram of the image

Return type

np.ndarray

check_valid_compare_method() → Callable

Checks whether the chosen comparison method is valid.

Parameters

func (Callable) – callable function

img_grid(img: Union[numpy.ndarray, str], hgrid: int = 5, wgrid: int = 5) → List[numpy.ndarray]

Divide an image in equally-sized fragments, conforming a grid with hgrid columns and wgrid rows.

Parameters

  • img (Union[np.ndarray,str]) – image or path to target image.

  • hgrid (int, optional) – number of columns to compute the image grid, defaults to 5

  • wgrid (int, optional) – number of rows to compute the image grid, defaults to 5

Returns

grid of subimages.

Return type

List[np.ndarray]

search(img: Union[numpy.ndarray, str], compare_method: str, topk: int = 10, **kwargs) → List[numpy.ndarray]

Performs basic histogram search. On the regular, less accurate than smart histogram search, albeit noticeably faster for large datasets.

Parameters

  • img (Union[np.ndarray,str]) – image or path to target image.

  • compare_method (str) – comparison method

  • topk (int, optional) – top k images to retrieve, defaults to 10

Returns

top k most relevant images

Return type

List[np.ndarray]

Returns

precomputed grid histograms.

Return type

dict

property serial_hist: dict

Getter method for serial_hist

Returns

precomputed histograms.

Return type

dict

serialize(filename: str = 'serial\\hist_serial.pkl', grid: bool = False, **kwargs)

Serialize the histogram of colours of the images in a dataset.

Parameters

  • filename (str, optional) – output filepath, defaults to “serialcolour_serial.pkl”

  • grid (bool, optional) – whether to compute histograms by regions (in a grid-like fashion), defaults to False

Returns

collection of dominant colours and their frequence

smart_search(img: Union[numpy.ndarray, str], compare_method: str, topk: int = 10, **kwargs) → List[numpy.ndarray]

Performs smart histogram search.

Parameters

  • img (Union[np.ndarray,str]) – image or path to target image.

  • compare_method (str) – comparison method

  • topk (int, optional) – top k images to retrieve, defaults to 10

Returns

top k most relevant images

Colour search (colour_search.py)

class colour_search.ColourSearch(dataset: Union[Iterable[numpy.ndarray], str], serial_colour_path: Optional[str] = None)

This class implements a colour search IR method.

__init__(dataset: Union[Iterable[numpy.ndarray], str], serial_colour_path: Optional[str] = None) → None

Constructor for a HistogramSearch instance.

Parameters

  • dataset (iterable collection of images.) – dataset of images or path to the directory containg input samples.

  • serial_colour_path (str, optional) – path to serialize the computed dominant colours, defaults to None.

dominant_colours(img: str, n_colours: int = 5, show_palette: bool = False, kmeans_max_iter: int = 200, kmeans_eps: float = 0.1, kmeans_init: int = 0, kmeans_max_attempts: int = 10) → Tuple[Iterable[numpy.ndarray], Iterable[numpy.ndarray]]

Compute the n_colours most representative colours of an image located in the path img.

Parameters

  • img (str) – Path to an image

  • n_colours (int, optional) – Number of representative colours to get from the image, defaults to 5

  • show_palette (bool, optional) – show the resultant colour palette, defaults to False

  • kmeans_max_iter (int, optional) – Maximum number of iterations for k-means, defaults to 200

  • kmeans_eps (float, optional) – Epsilon value for k-means, defaults to 0.1

  • kmeans_init (int, optional) – K-means nitialization method, defaults to cv2.KMEANS_RANDOM_CENTERS

  • kmeans_max_attempts (int, optional) – Maximum number of attempts of the k-means algorithm, defaults to 10

Returns

Collection of dominant colours and their frequence of appearance.

Return type

Tuple[Iterable[np.ndarray], Iterable[np.ndarray]]

score_colour_img(colour: numpy.ndarray, palette: Iterable[numpy.ndarray]) → float

Returns the minimum euclidean distance between the target colour and the dominant colours of an image, encoded in palette

Parameters

  • colour (np.ndarray) – target colour

  • palette (Iterable[np.ndarray]) – Collection of dominant colours

Returns

Distance to the semantically closest colour to the target colour.

Return type

float

search(colour: numpy.ndarray, topk=10) → List[numpy.ndarray]

Search images in dataset matching with similar colours to colour.

Parameters

  • colour (array like (e.g., np.ndarray)) – query colour

  • topk (int, optional) – top k images to retrieve, defaults to 10

Returns

top k most relevant images found

Return type

List[np.ndarray]

Utils (utils.py)

utils.load_serialized_data(filename: str, return_dict_values: bool = False) → Union[dict, Any]

Utility to load serialized data (and other optional stored values) from disk using pickle.

Parameters

  • filename (str) – Filename of the file to be loaded.

  • return_dict_values (bool, optional) – If set to True, returns the values just the values of the dictionary containing all stored data, defaults to False.

Returns

Loaded data

Return type

Union[dict, Any]

utils.makedir(path: str, remove_filename: bool = False, recursive: bool = True, exist_ok: bool = True, **kwargs) → None

Creates directory from path if not exists.

Parameters

  • path (str) – Path of the directory to be created.

  • remove_filename (bool, optional) – If set to True, it attempts to remove the filename from the path, defaults to False

  • recursive (bool, optional) – Creates directories recursively (i.e., create necessary subdirectories if necessary), defaults to True

  • exist_ok (bool, optional) – is set to False, arises an error if path directory exists, defaults to True

utils.plot_img_grid(data: Iterable, col_space_conv: Optional[int] = None, **kwargs) → None

Plot grid of data

Parameters

  • data (iterable) – iterable of filepaths to images or plots

  • col_space_conv (int, optional) – custom colour space conversion, defaults to None

utils.remove_filename_from_path(out_filename: str, path_standard_format: bool = False) → str

Attempts to remove filename from the provided path.

Parameters

  • out_filename (str) – Filepath.

  • path_standard_format (bool, optional) – Indicates whether the path follows the standard format (backslash separator) or the slash separator, defaults to False.

Returns

The directory excluding the filename.

Return type

str

utils.resize_img(img: numpy.ndarray, width: int = 250, height: Optional[int] = None) → numpy.ndarray

Utility to resize an image.

Parameters

  • img (np.ndarray) – image to resize

  • width (int, optional) – new width of the image, defaults to 250

  • height (int, optional) – new height of the image, defaults to None

Raises

ValueError – if neither the new width or height is specified

Returns

resized image

Return type

np.ndarray

utils.scan_files(fdir: str, file_extension: str = 'jpg') → numpy.ndarray

Scan files recursively from a directory with a specific file extension.

Parameters

  • fdir (str) – Source directory.

  • file_extension (str, optional) – File extension, defaults to ‘jpg’.

Returns

collection of items satisfying the conditions specified

Return type

np.ndarray

utils.store_serialized_data(data, out_filename: str = 'serial\\serialized_data.pkl', protocol: int = 5) → None

Utility to dump precomputed data to disk using pickle.

Parameters

  • data – Tensor type data structure containing the dominant colours or histogram(s) for each sample in the dataset

  • out_filename (str, optional) – Path for the output file, defaults to ‘serialserialized_data.pkl’.

  • protocol – Protocol used for pickle, defaults to pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL.
